page.title: 15HISTORY OF THE AIRPORT HOTEL
page.content: The{St. George Hotel}is situated within the airport grounds and is run in conjunction with the airport. It accommodates mainly aircrews and national sales representatives usually only for one-night stays. The Hotel is{40 years}old and the outside has not changed at all in that time. During the 2nd World War, it was built as an officers' mess so the walls are 25cm thick with a steel plate running through the middle for {bomb-proofing. Today, inside, you would not believe you were in the same building. The bedrooms are{ very modern}with hair-driers, trouser-presses etc. The walls are insulated from aircraft noise, because of their thickness. To maintain the RAF link, the suites have been named after planes eg {Spitfire}and{Hurricane}suites.
